greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest infinite sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A046523(A276087(i)) = A046523(A276087(j)) for all i, j.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of function f(n) = A278226(A276086(n)) = A046523(A276086(A276086(n))).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..32589
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ From A046523
A276086(n) = { my(m=1, p=2); while(n, m *= (p^(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m); };
xref: Cf. A143293 (positions of 1's after the initial one).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 15 2019
